posts.message:
hello geeks,
suppose I have a high-volume Video website like Coursera and pluralsight, what is best and affordable way to host these large amount of video files. I did some reading and many suggested a CDN service, so if you faced this situation, what is the best CDN for this scenario that give me insights and statistics and also give me full control over the video player to implement my own brand?
thanks

Does anyone know a simple & user-friendly website that teaches #Code to kids??
My nephew LOVES games & I think he can possibly become a good developer one day if he started learning to code.
He's turning 12 soon.

The more different teams you work with, The more experience you gain .
and also in every project there is different way of thinking, architecture or useful tools .
why we not share this knowledge with each other ?

أنا شايف ان لازم ال
DB Servers

posts.message:
Morning,
I'm trying to analyze the current job market in Egypt. More specifically, I'm doing a survey to collect data about the salaries of software engineers. Would you please take a minute to contribute?

Link: https://goo.gl/forms/2t104vQuR61Di8ZU2

All responses are anonymous.

Snapchat officially files for an IPO
They have 158m daily active users, 2.5 billion daily snaps sent.
When Facebook filed for theirs, they had 845m monthly active users, 2.7 billion daily likes & comments.

posts.message:
i have a question regarding Angular 2, i was digging about using 3rd parties libs into angular 2 apps and i found that i can either include a script tag then declare the main object as a global, or look for a typing to this particular lib.

both ways works fine, but my question is which is a best practice ?! i think the answer is to look for a typed version but what i have noticed is that the typed version doesn't include all the lib features ( based on certain libs i need to use ), so again is the script tag bad practice ?

Edit: what i mentioned about script tag in the index.html file and also include installing the lib via npm and import it angular-cli.json [scripts]
